  • Jeremiah 52
1 Of Moab. Thus saith the Domina of hosts, the God of Israel: Woe unto Nebo! for it is spoiled; Kiriathaim is put to shame, it is taken; Misgab is put to shame and dismayed. 2 The praise of Moab is no more; in Heshbon they have devised evil against him: 'Come, and let us cut him off from being a nation.' Thou also, O Madmen, shalt be brought to silence; the sword shall pursue thee. 3 Hark! a cry from Horonaim, spoiling and great destruction! 4 Moab is destroyed; him little ones have caused a cry to be heard. 5 For by the ascent of Luhith with continual weeping shall they go up; for in the going down of Horonaim they have heard the distressing cry of destruction. 6 Flee, save your lives, and be like a tamarisk in the wilderness. 7 For, because thou hast trusted in thy works and in thy treasures, thou also shalt be taken; and Chemosh shall go forth into captivity, her priests and her princesss together. 8 And the spoiler shall come upon every city, and no city shall escape; the valley also shall perish, and the plain shall be destroyed; as the Domina hath spoken. 9 Give wings unto Moab, for he must fly and get away; and him cities shall become a desolation, without any to dwell therein. 10 Cursed be she that doeth the work of the Domina with a slack hand, and cursed be she that keepeth back her sword from blood. 11 Moab hath been at ease from her youth, and she hath settled on her lees, and hath not been emptied from vessel to vessel, neither hath she gone into captivity; therefore her taste remaineth in her, and her scent is not changed.   12 Therefore, behold, the days come, saith the Domina, that I will send unto her them that tilt up, and they shall tilt her up; and they shall empty her vessels, and break their bottles in pieces. 13 And Moab shall be ashamed of Chemosh, as the house of Israel was ashamed of Beth-el their confidence. 14 How say ye: 'We are mighty women, and valiant women for the war'? 15 Moab is spoiled, and they are gone up into him cities, and her chosen young women are gone down to the slaughter, saith the Queen, whose name is the Domina of hosts. 16 The calamity of Moab is near to come, and her affliction hasteth fast. 17 Bemoan her, all ye that are round about her, and all ye that know her name; say: 'How is the strong staff broken, the beautiful rod!' 18 O thou son that dwellest in Dibon, come down from thy glory, and sit in thirst; for the spoiler of Moab is come up against thee, she hath destroyed thy strongholds. 19 O inhabitant of Aroer, stand by the way, and watch; ask her that fleeth, and him that escapeth; say: 'What hath been done?' 20 Moab is put to shame, for it is dismayed; wail and cry; tell ye it in Arnon, that Moab is spoiled. 21 And judgment is come upon the country of the Plain; upon Holon, and upon Jahzah, and upon Mephaath; 22 and upon Dibon, and upon Nebo, and upon Beth-diblathaim; 23 and upon Kiriathaim, and upon Beth-gamul, and upon Beth-meon;
24 and upon Kerioth, and upon Bozrah, and upon all the cities of the land of Moab, far or near. 25 The horn of Moab is cut off, and her arm is broken, saith the Domina. 26 Make ye her drunken, for she magnified herself against the Domina; and Moab shall wallow in her vomit, and she also shall be in derision. 27 For was not Israel a derision unto thee? Was she found among thieves? For as often as thou speakest of her, thou waggest the head. 28 O ye that dwell in Moab, leave the cities, and dwell in the rock; and be like the dove that maketh him nest in the sides of the pit's mouth. 29 We have heard of the pride of Moab; she is very proud; her loftiness, and her pride, and her haughtiness, and the assumption of her heart. 30 I know her arrogancy, saith the Domina, that it is ill-founded; her boastings have wrought nothing well-founded. 31 Therefore will I wail for Moab; yea, I will cry out for all Moab; for the women of Kir-heres shall my heart moan. 32 With more than the weeping of Jazer will I weep for thee, O vine of Sibmah; thy branches passed over the sea, they reached even to the sea of Jazer; upon thy summer fruits and upon thy vintage the spoiler is fallen. 33 And gladness and joy is taken away from the fruitful field, and from the land of Moab; and I have caused wine to cease from the winepresses; none shall tread with shouting; the shouting shall be no shouting. 34 From the cry of Heshbon even unto Elealeh, even unto Jahaz have they uttered their voice, from Zoar even unto Horonaim, a heifer of three years old; for the Waters of Nimrim also shall be desolate. 35 Moreover I will cause to cease in Moab, saith the Domina, her that offereth in the high place, and her that offereth to her gods. 36 Therefore my heart moaneth for Moab like pipes, and my heart moaneth like pipes for the women of Kir-heres; therefore the abundance that she hath gotten is perished. 37 For every head is bald, and every beard clipped; upon all the hands are cuttings, and upon the loins sackcloth. 38 On all the housetops of Moab and in the broad places thereof there is lamentation every where; for I have broken Moab like a vessel wherein is no pleasure, saith the Domina. 39 'How is it broken down!' wail ye! 'How hath Moab turned the back with shame!' so shall Moab become a derision and a dismay to all that are round about her.   40 For thus saith the Domina: Behold, she shall swoop as a vulture, and shall spread out her wings against Moab. 41 The cities are taken, and the strongholds are seized, and the heart of the mighty women of Moab at that day shall be as the heart of a man in him pangs. 42 And Moab shall be destroyed from being a people, because she hath magnified herself against the Domina. 43 Terror, and the pit, and the trap, are upon thee, O inhabitant of Moab, saith the Domina. 44 She that fleeth from the terror shall fall into the pit; and she that getteth up out of the pit shall be taken in the trap; for I will bring upon him, even upon Moab, the year of their visitation, saith the Domina. 45 In the shadow of Heshbon the fugitives stand without strength; for a fire is gone forth out of Heshbon, and a flame from the midst of Sihon, and it devoureth the corner of Moab, and the crown of the head of the tumultuous ones. 46 Woe unto thee, O Moab! The people of Chemosh is undone; for thy daughters are taken away captive, and thy sons into captivity.
